Key Match Events: Jack Flaherty allowed a solo homer to Fernando Tatis Jr. in the first inning.
David Peralta hit a two-out, two-run homer to center field off Flaherty in the second inning.
Mookie Betts thought he had hit a solo homer, but it was caught by Jurickson Profar.
The Dodgers loaded the bases with nobody out in the second inning, but only managed to score one run due to a double play.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts commented on the need for the offense to step up and the importance of catching a lead.
Dodgers second baseman Gavin Lux emphasized the importance of moving on to the next game and taking it at-bat by at-bat.
Dodgers outfielder Teoscar Hernández highlighted the need to keep getting better and fighting at-bats.
Dodgers shortstop Miguel Rojas reflected on the series now being a three-game series and the need to win two more games to move on.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' pitching concerns were highlighted as they have allowed 22 runs on 26 hits over 13 innings in their past five postseason games.
The best-of-five series is now tied at one game apiece, with the next games heading to Petco Park, giving San Diego the edge.
The bad blood between the Dodgers and Padres resurfaced throughout the course of the night, with Flaherty and Manny Machado taking center stage.
